Class Piece

java.lang.Object
Piece
public class Piece extends Object
The Piece class represents a chess piece on the board. It includes attributes such as the piece's color, type (e.g., pawn, rook, knight, etc.), and whether it has been moved. The class provides methods to manipulate and access these attributes, as well as methods for converting the piece to a string representation and creating a piece from a string.

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece(Color c, Piece.PieceType t, boolean v)
      Constructs a Piece with the specified color, type, and moved status.
      Parameters:
      c - The color of the piece (either Color.WHITE or Color.BLACK).
      t - The type of the piece (e.g., PieceType.PAWN, PieceType.ROOK).
      v - The flag indicating if the piece has moved (true if moved, false if not).

  • Method Details

    • clone

      public Piece clone()
      Creates and returns a new Piece that is a clone of the current piece.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      A new Piece object that is a copy of the current piece.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the piece. The string is the lowercase letter corresponding to the piece type, and uppercase if the piece is white.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the piece, e.g., "p" for a black pawn, "P" for a white pawn.

    • fromString

      public static Piece fromString(String str)
      Creates a Piece from the given string representation. The string is case-sensitive and indicates both the type and color of the piece (e.g., "p" for black pawn, "P" for white pawn).
      Parameters:
      str - A string representation of the piece, where lowercase letters represent black pieces and uppercase letters represent white pieces.
      Returns:
      A Piece object corresponding to the given string, or null if the string is invalid.

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      Gets the color of the piece.
      Returns:
      The color of the piece (either Color.WHITE or Color.BLACK).

    • getType

      public Piece.PieceType getType()
      Gets the type of the piece.
      Returns:
      The type of the piece (e.g., PAWN, ROOK, KNIGHT).

    • hasMoved

      public boolean hasMoved()
      Checks if the piece has moved.
      Returns:
      True if the piece has moved, otherwise false.

    • setHasMoved

      public void setHasMoved(boolean b)
      Sets the moved status of the piece.
      Parameters:
      b - A boolean indicating whether the piece has moved (true if moved, false otherwise).
